item.title: About Me
item.description:
Profile

Name: Changrui Chen (陈常瑞)
Institute: WMG, University of Warwick, Conventry, UK
Position: PhD student
E-Mail: Firstname.Lastname [AT] warwick.ac.uk

Research Interests

My research interests focus on object detection in many application environments (e.g., drone-captured images, underwater images). Besides, I also interest in mining the relation in natural images to boost the deep learning segmentation algorithm under weakly supervised or unsupervised condition.

Education
PhD 2020 - now University of Warwick, WMG
Master 2017 - 2020 Ocean University of China, Vision Lab, Computer Technology
Bachelor 2013 - 2017 Ocean University of China, Computer Science and Technology

Publications

  1. Highlight Every Step: Knowledge Distillation via Collaborative Teaching

    Xin Sun; Haoran Zhao; Junyu Dong; Changrui Chen; Zihe Dong

    IEEE Transaction on Cybernetics, 2020

  2. Learning Deep Relation to Promote Saliency Detection

    Changrui Chen; Xin Sun; Yang Hua; Junyu Dong; Hongwei Xv

    Thirty-Fourth AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence (AAAI) Oral, 2020

  3. Exploring Ubiquitous Relations for Boosting Classification and Localizations

    Xin Sun; Changrui Chen; Junyu Dong; Dan Liu; Guosheng Hu

    Knowledge-based Systems, 2020

  4. RRNet: A Hybrid Detector for Object Detection in Drone-captured Images

    Changrui Chen; Yu Zhang; Qingxuan Lv; Shuo Wei; Xiaorui Wang; Xin Sun; Junyu Dong

    IEEE International Conference on Computer Vision Workshop (ICCVW), 2019

  5. Few-shot Learning for Domain-specific Fine-grained Image Classification

    Xin Sun; Hongwei Xv; Junyu Dong; Qiong Li; Changrui Chen

    IEEE Transactions on Industrial Electronics, 2019

Honors and Awards

  1. 2019 IEEE International Conference on Computer Vision (ICCV) Vision Meets Drones Challenge

    Object Detection in Images: Runner-up (Role: Leader)

  2. 2017 Underwater Robot Piking Contest (Organized by National Natural Science Foundation of China)

    Object Detection(online): First Award

  3. 2018 Underwater Robot Piking Contest

    Object Detection(offline): Second Award

    Object Picking: Third Award

  4. Ocean University of China Outstanding Graduate Student

Research Projects

  1. Graduate Student Foundation of Ocean University of China

    Object Detection in Complex Underwater Environment

    March 2018 - March 2019 (Leader)

  2. Student Research Development Project of Ocean University of China

    A Medical Assistance Application based on Miband

    2016 (Leader)
